verse:
अहो इमं पश्यत मे विनाशं तपस्विनः सच्चरितव्रतस्य ।
अन्तर्जले वारिचरप्रसङ्गात् प्रच्यावितं ब्रह्म चिरं धृतं यत् ॥

terms.tapasvinaḥ: who was such a great mystic performing austerity
terms.sat-carita: of very good character, observing all necessary rules and regulations
terms.vratasya: of one who has taken a vow strictly
terms.antaḥ-jale: in the depths of the water
terms.vāri-cara-prasaṅgāt: because of the affairs of the aquatics
terms.brahma: from the activities of Brahman realization or austerity

vedabase.translation: Alas! While practicing austerity, even within the depths of the water, and while observing all the rules and regulations practiced by saintly persons, I lost the results of my long austerities simply by association with the sexual affairs of fish. Everyone should observe this falldown and learn from it.

terms.सच्चरितव्रतस्य (saccharitravratasya): who observe righteous conduct and vows
terms.वारिचरप्रसङ्गात् (varicharaprasangat): because of the attack by aquatic animals

bard.meaning: Alas, see my destruction, of the ascetic, of the virtuous vow, in the water, of the water-walking, being immersed, brahman, for a long time, held that.
